p: The most commonly applied methods to study the antioxidant ability are ABTS and DPPH. Both have excellent stability under certain conditions, although they also show differences. DPPH is a free radical that can be obtained directly without previous preparation, while the ABTS has to be generated after a reaction that can be chemical, enzymatic, or electrochemical [ 78]. However, the results obtained with the methods allow one to reach practically similar conclusions.
